skills.name: Order negative decimals with the same number of digits
Carry out missing number subtraction problems involving negative integers
Perform calculations with temperature when given in the same units
Find the absolute value of a number
Count backwards through zero starting from a positive integer

explanations.A: It takes 1 to get to floor 3, 2 to get to 2, 3 to get to 1, 4 to get to 0, 5 to get to -1,
explanations.B: Read carefully what floor the gym is on.
explanations.C: Does John need to travel at all to remain on floor 4? How many does it take to get to floor 3? 2? ...
explanations.D: There are 4 floors in BETWEEN John and the gym, but how many jumps is this?

explanations.A: Does Asha need to travel at all to remain on floor 7? How many does it take to get to floor 6? 5? ...
explanations.B: Read carefully what floor the car park is on.
explanations.C: Asha needs to go down 7 floors to get to floor 0, then she has an additional 2 floors to go down in order to get to floor -2.
explanations.D: Count the number of "jumps" Asha needs to take.

explanations.A: Look carefully at the signs of the numbers, is -7 the same as 7?
explanations.B: You've worked out the difference correctly, but which one is colder?
explanations.C: Look carefully at the signs of the numbers, is 5 the same as -5?
explanations.D: 5 is 5 above zero, and -7 is 7 below zero, so the difference between them is 12.

explanations.A: Look carefully at the signs of the numbers, is 2 the same as -2?
explanations.B: -5 is 5 below zero, and 2 is 2 above zero, so the difference between them is 7.
explanations.C: Look carefully at the signs of the numbers, is 5 the same as -5?
explanations.D: You've worked out the difference correctly, but which one is colder?

explanations.A: -8.3m means 8.3 metres below the surface. Is this the deepest?
explanations.B: "Deepest" means furthest away from the surface. I think you have done the closest to the surface first.
explanations.C: -9 is the lowest, then -8.3, then -7 is the closest to the surface.
explanations.D: The starfish is only 7m below the surface. You need to put the deepest animal first.

explanations.A: -2.6m means 2.6 metres below the surface. Which creature is deeper than this?
explanations.B: The Ling is only 1.5m below sea level. Which creature is furthest from the surface?
explanations.C: "Deepest" means furthest away from the surface (0m). I think you started with the creature closest to the surface.
explanations.D: -6 is the lowest, then -2.6, then -1.5 is the closest to the surface.

explanations.A: Not quite. Remember absolute value looks at how large a number is, it does not take the sign of the number into account.
explanations.B: The absolute value of a number is how large the number is irrespective of its sign. Therefore the absolute value of -3 is 3.
explanations.C: Not quite. Remember absolute value looks at how large a number is, it does not take the sign of the number into account.
explanations.D: Not quite. I think you have squared three. The absolute value looks at how large a number is, it does not take the sign of the number into account.

explanations.A: Not quite. Remember absolute value looks at how large a number is, it does not take the sign of the number into account.
explanations.B: Not quite. I think you have square rooted 16. Remember absolute value looks at how large a number is, it does not take the sign of the number into account.
explanations.C: The absolute value of a number is how large the number is irrespective of its sign. Therefore the absolute value of -16 is 16.
explanations.D: Not quite. Remember absolute value looks at how large a number is, it does not take the sign of the number into account.

explanations.A: We have to work out what we need to subtract to get from -4 to 3. Because we need to move up the number line the only way to do this with a subtraction is to subtract a negative. -4 - -7 = 3 because subtracting -7 is the same as adding +7
explanations.B: Not quite. Imagine a numberline. How far do I need to move up the numberline to get from -4 to +3? How can I do this using a subtraction?
explanations.C: Nearly! If I was starting at -4 and subtracting 7 I would end up at -11. How can we move further up the numberline while still using subtraction?
explanations.D: Not quite. Imagine a numberline. How far do I need to move up the numberline to get from -4 to +3? How can I do this using a subtraction?

explanations.A: Not quite. Imagine a numberline. How far do I need to move up the numberline to get from -3 to +5? How can I do this using a subtraction?
explanations.B: Not quite. Imagine a numberline. How far do I need to move up the numberline to get from -3 to +5? How can I do this using a subtraction?
explanations.C: Nearly! If I was starting at -3 and subtracting 8 I would end up at -11. How can we move further up the numberline while still using subtraction?
explanations.D: We have to work out what we need to subtract to get from -3 to 5. Because we need to move up the number line the only way to do this with a subtraction is to subtract a negative. -3 - -8 = 5 because subtracting -8 is the same as adding +8
